title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: file minimum guidance agentic work Rtinycc. Read relevant code changes, keep edits small focused, update tests/docs change behavior. Agents must read actual implementations guessing. need third-party code headers, check .sync directory local copies libraries depend can read directly instead assuming behavior. also generate <package>.llm.txt files R package docs; example, treesitter.c docs can found treesitter.c.llm.txt.

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: Rtinycc embeds TinyCC exposes CLI libtcc APIs R. provides Bun-style FFI generates SEXP wrappers runtime, compiles TinyCC, calls via .Call.

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: tcc_get_symbol() calls RC_libtcc_get_symbol(), converts raw void* TinyCC DL_FUNC wraps R_MakeExternalPtrFn (tagged native symbol). make_callable() passes external pointer .RtinyccCall (base::.Call). Rf_install cast function pointer; Rf_install sets native symbol tag.

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: Scalar types: i8, i16, i32, i64, f32, f64, bool, cstring. Array arguments (zero-copy): raw, integer_array, numeric_array, logical_array, character_array. Array returns: returns = list(type = "*_array", length_arg = <index>, free = TRUE) copies new R vector optionally frees C buffer. Struct array fields: list(type = "u8", size = N, array = TRUE) generates element accessors struct_<name>_get_<field>_elt() / struct_<name>_set_<field>_elt(). Pointers: ptr sexp exposed external pointers; ownership tracked enforced RC_free tcc_ptr_is_owned().

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: make rd regenerates roxygen output. make test runs tinytest. single file: R -e "tinytest::run_test_file('inst/tinytest/<file>.R')". Development plumbing: run air format edits, use make install local installs, make check CRAN-style checks, make rdm regenerate README. Always add update tinytests behavior changes.

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: Use roxygen2 exported functions run make rd docs change. Keep tidyverse-style formatting (2-space indent, spaces around operators). Prefer early returns explicit error messages stop(..., call. = FALSE). Update README examples change user-facing behavior.

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: macOS configure script strips -flat_namespace TCC’s Makefile avoid SIGEV-related issues. Without flat namespace, TCC resolve symbols exported R package (RC_free_finalizer, RC_invoke_callback, RC_invoke_callback_id, RC_callback_async_schedule_c) dynamic linker relocation time, causing “undefined symbol” errors. fix RC_libtcc_add_host_symbols() src/RC_libtcc.c, explicitly registers host symbols via tcc_add_symbol() tcc_relocate(). called R/ffi.R compilation call sites. new C function generated TCC code references must added RC_libtcc_add_host_symbols() break macOS Windows.

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: Windows support required solving several interacting problems. section documents every workaround future agents don’t undo duplicate .

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: configure.win unpacks vendored TCC tarball, builds libtcc.dll, libtcc., tcc.exe, libtcc1.using Rtools MinGW toolchain, installs inst/tinycc/. build generates .def files R UCRT (see ) cleans source tree. Makevars.win dynamically links Rtinycc.dll libtcc.dll (static .). keeps symbols like _exit abort Rtinycc.dll — stay libtcc.dll, avoiding R CMD check NOTEs entry points terminate R. install.libs.R copies libtcc.dll next Rtinycc.dll inside installed package. Windows rpath; PE loader searches directory containing loading DLL first, Windows equivalent.

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: TCC ships stdlib.h, stdio.h, math.h, etc. include/. conflict Rtools/MinGW headers used compile Rtinycc.dll . avoid conflict, libtcc.h installed separate inst/tinycc/libtcc/ directory, Makevars.win uses -$(TINYCC_DIR)/libtcc (-$(TINYCC_DIR)/include). TCC’s system headers still go inst/tinycc/include/ JIT runtime use .

what: CRT heap mismatch — ucrt.def replaces msvcrt.def
title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: R 4.2+ links UCRT (ucrtbase.dll). TCC, default, links JIT code msvcrt.dll (auto-links “msvcrt” tccpe.c). JIT code calls calloc() msvcrt host calls free() UCRT (RC_free_finalizer ), heap mismatch causes crash. fix configure.win: generate .def file ucrtbase.dll using tcc -impdef, name output msvcrt.def. overwrites TCC’s original msvcrt.def. Since TCC’s PE linker loads “msvcrt” automatically, CRT symbols (calloc, free, printf, etc.) now resolve ucrtbase.dll — CRT R Rtinycc.dll use.

what: Externalptr ownership and finalizers (Windows crash class)
title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: observed Windows-segfaults running tinytest::test_package(...) single R session, especially gc() process exit. caused UCRT mismatches; caused multiple externalptr wrappers owning TCCState*, leading double-finalization GC runs. External pointers copied R, easy accidentally create multiple externalptrs around C pointer C/R helpers. Fix pattern: Track ownership TCCState* explicitly C. one externalptr “owned” gets RC_tcc_finalizer. wrappers “borrowed” get -op finalizer. Borrowed wrappers keep owner alive via externalptr prot field. Implementation lives src/RC_libtcc.c: tcc_state_entry_t registry, RC_tcc_state_is_owned(), ownership tags rtinycc_tcc_state_owned / rtinycc_tcc_state_borrowed. reintroduce shutdown/unload hooks “solve” ; correct fix ownership tracking preventing double-finalization.

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: TCC JIT code calls R API functions (Rf_ScalarInteger, Rf_error, R_NilValue, etc.). Windows live R.dll. configure.win generates R.def R.dll via tcc -impdef places inst/tinycc/lib/. compile time, R/ffi.R calls tcc_add_library(state, "R") Windows, makes TCC load R.def resolve R API symbols R.dll.

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: Windows (macOS), TCC find package-internal C functions (RC_free_finalizer, RC_invoke_callback_id, RC_callback_async_schedule_c) dynamic linker. RC_libtcc_add_host_symbols() registers via tcc_add_symbol() direct function pointers tcc_relocate(). functions init.c / exported via .Call — called TCC-generated JIT code.

what: snprintf is not exported from ucrtbase.dll
title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: UCRT, snprintf inline function headers calls __stdio_common_vsprintf. direct DLL export, TCC’s JIT linker can’t find . original callback trampoline codegen used snprintf convert callback token id (int) string, called RC_invoke_callback(SEXP string, SEXP args) atoi get int back — pointless round-trip. fix: RC_invoke_callback_id(int id, SEXP args) RC_libtcc.c takes int directly. trampoline codegen R/callbacks.R now calls RC_invoke_callback_id(tok->id, args) instead, eliminating snprintf, mkString, atoi round-trip entirely. forward declaration R/ffi_codegen.R updated match.

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: Async callbacks rely pipe(), pthread_create, R’s addInputHandler() — none exist Windows. RC_libtcc.c #ifdef _WIN32 stubs call Rf_error("Async callbacks supported Windows") R-facing functions, return -1 C-facing RC_callback_async_schedule_c. async callback tests test_callback_invoke_runtime.R guarded (.Platform$OS.type != "windows").

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: Unix, math functions live libm.require -lm. Windows, part CRT (ucrtbase.dll). tests using tcc_link("m") tcc_library("m") must guarded (.Platform$OS.type != "windows").

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: R’s parallel::mclapply uses fork() exist Windows. Fork-related tests test_fork_serialize.R guarded (.Platform$OS.type != "windows").

title: Rtinycc Agent Guidelines (Short)
text: configure.win: Build TCC source, generate R.def ucrt.def src/Makevars.win: Dynamic linking libtcc.dll src/install.libs.R: Copy libtcc.dll next Rtinycc.dll .github/workflows/windows.yml: Windows CI

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: Rtinycc R interface TinyCC, providing CLI access libtcc-backed -memory compiler. includes experimental FFI inspired Bun’s FFI binding C symbols predictable type conversions pointer utilities. package runs unix-alikes ( windows may never supported subtle UCRT issues, use WSL2) focuses embedding TinyCC enabling JIT-compiled bindings directly R. Combined treesitter.c, provides C header parsers, can used rapidly generate declarative bindings.

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: call tcc_compile(), Rtinycc generates C wrapper functions whose signature follows .Call convention (SEXP , SEXP ). wrappers convert R types C, call target function, convert result back. TCC compiles -memory – shared library written disk R_init_* registration needed. tcc_relocate(), wrapper pointers retrieved via tcc_get_symbol(), internally calls RC_libtcc_get_symbol(). function converts TCC’s raw void* DL_FUNC wrapped R_MakeExternalPtrFn (tagged "native symbol"). R side, make_callable() creates closure passes external pointer .Call (aliased .RtinyccCall keep R CMD check happy). design follows CFFI’s API-mode pattern: instead computing struct layouts calling conventions R (ABI-mode, like Python’s ctypes), generated C code lets TCC handle sizeof, offsetof, argument passing. Rtinycc never replicates platform-specific layout rules. wrappers can also link external shared libraries whose symbols TCC resolves relocation time. background compares libffi approach, see RSimpleFFI README. macOS configure script strips -flat_namespace TCC’s build avoid BUS ERROR issues. Without , TCC resolve host symbols (e.g. RC_free_finalizer) dynamic linker. Rtinycc works around RC_libtcc_add_host_symbols(), registers package-internal C functions via tcc_add_symbol() relocation. new C function referenced generated TCC code must added . Windows, build still generates UCRT-backed msvcrt.def TinyCC resolves CRT symbols ucrtbase.dll (R 4.2+ uses UCRT). avoids cross-CRT heap mismatches, root cause segfaults investigated. crashes due lifetime management external pointers finalizers: multiple externalptr wrappers owning TCCState* led double finalization garbage collector ran. fix track ownership explicitly ensure one externalptr owns given state. Ownership semantics explicit. Pointers tcc_malloc() tagged rtinycc_owned can released tcc_free() (R finalizer). Generated struct constructors use struct-specific tag (struct_<name>) RC_free_finalizer; free struct_<name>_free(), tcc_free(). Pointers tcc_data_ptr() tagged rtinycc_borrowed never freed Rtinycc. Array returns copied fresh R vector; set free = TRUE C function returns malloc-owned buffer.

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: CLI interface compiles C source files standalone executables using bundled TinyCC toolchain. -memory workflows, prefer libtcc instead.
code: library(Rtinycc)  src <- system.file("c_examples", "forty_two.c", package = "Rtinycc") exe <- tempfile() tcc_run_cli(c(   "-B", tcc_prefix(),   paste0("-I", tcc_include_paths()),   paste0("-L", tcc_lib_paths()),   src, "-o", exe )) #> [1] 0 Sys.chmod(exe, mode = "0755") system2(exe, stdout = TRUE) #> [1] "42"

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: can compile call C functions entirely memory. simplest path quick JIT compilation. lower-level API gives full control include paths, libraries, R C API. Using #define _Complex workaround TCC’s lack complex type support, can link R’s headers call libR.
code: state <- tcc_state(output = "memory") tcc_compile_string(state, "int forty_two(){ return 42; }") #> [1] 0 tcc_relocate(state) #> [1] 0 tcc_call_symbol(state, "forty_two", return = "int") #> [1] 42 state <- tcc_state(output = "memory") tcc_add_include_path(state, R.home("include")) #> [1] 0 tcc_add_library_path(state, R.home("lib")) #> [1] 0  code <- ' #define _Complex #include <R.h> #include <Rinternals.h>  double call_r_sqrt(void) {   SEXP fn   = PROTECT(Rf_findFun(Rf_install("sqrt"), R_BaseEnv));   SEXP val  = PROTECT(Rf_ScalarReal(16.0));   SEXP call = PROTECT(Rf_lang2(fn, val));   SEXP out  = PROTECT(Rf_eval(call, R_GlobalEnv));   double res = REAL(out)[0];   UNPROTECT(4);   return res; } ' tcc_compile_string(state, code) #> [1] 0 tcc_relocate(state) #> [1] 0 tcc_call_symbol(state, "call_r_sqrt", return = "double") #> [1] 4

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: Rtinycc ships set typed memory access functions similar ctypesio package offers, designed around FFI pointer model. Every scalar C type corresponding tcc_read_* / tcc_write_* pair operates byte offset external pointer, can walk structs, arrays, output parameters without writing C helpers. Typed reads writes cover full scalar range (i8/u8, i16/u16, i32/u32, i64/u64, f32/f64) plus pointer dereferencing via tcc_read_ptr / tcc_write_ptr. operations use byte offset memcpy internally alignment safety. Pointer--pointer workflows supported C APIs return values output parameters.
code: ptr <- tcc_cstring("hello") tcc_read_cstring(ptr) #> [1] "hello" tcc_read_bytes(ptr, 5) #> [1] 68 65 6c 6c 6f tcc_ptr_addr(ptr, hex = TRUE) #> [1] "0x5612bb025090" tcc_ptr_is_null(ptr) #> [1] FALSE tcc_free(ptr) #> NULL buf <- tcc_malloc(32) tcc_write_i32(buf, 0L, 42L) tcc_write_f64(buf, 8L, pi) tcc_read_i32(buf, offset = 0L) #> [1] 42 tcc_read_f64(buf, offset = 8L) #> [1] 3.141593 tcc_free(buf) #> NULL ptr_ref <- tcc_malloc(.Machine$sizeof.pointer %||% 8L) target <- tcc_malloc(8) tcc_ptr_set(ptr_ref, target) #> <pointer: 0x5612b9c566b0> tcc_data_ptr(ptr_ref) #> <pointer: 0x5612b86c3c40> tcc_ptr_set(ptr_ref, tcc_null_ptr()) #> <pointer: 0x5612b9c566b0> tcc_free(target) #> NULL tcc_free(ptr_ref) #> NULL

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: declarative interface inspired Bun’s FFI sits top lower-level API. define types explicitly Rtinycc generates binding code, compiling memory TCC.

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: FFI exposes small set type mappings R C. Conversions explicit predictable callers know data shared versus copied. Scalar types map one--one: i8, i16, i32, i64 (integers); u8, u16, u32, u64 (unsigned); f32, f64 (floats); bool (logical); cstring (NUL-terminated string). Array arguments pass R vectors C zero copy: raw maps uint8_t*, integer_array int32_t*, numeric_array double*. Pointer types include ptr (opaque external pointer), sexp (pass SEXP directly), callback signatures like callback:double(double). Array returns use returns = list(type = "integer_array", length_arg = 2, free = TRUE) copy result new R vector. length_arg 1-based index C argument carries array length. Set free = TRUE C function returns malloc-owned buffer.

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
code: ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source("     int add(int a, int b) { return a + b; }   ") |>   tcc_bind(add = list(args = list("i32", "i32"), returns = "i32")) |>   tcc_compile()  ffi$add(5L, 3L) #> [1] 8  # Compare to the R builtin `+` in a tight loop. # Each FFI call allocates a return SEXP, so GC pressure is expected. r_p <- sample(10000) bench::mark(   Rtinycc = { for ( i in seq_along(r_p)) ffi$add(i, 1) },   Rbuiltin = { for ( i in seq_along(r_p)) i + 1 }  ) #> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is #> disabled. #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec` #>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl> #> 1 Rtinycc    193.03ms 197.98ms      5.06   53.98KB     6.75 #> 2 Rbuiltin     3.46ms   4.34ms    235.      9.05KB     1.99  # For performance-sensitive code, move the loop into C and operate on arrays. ffi_vec <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source(" \     void add_vec(int32_t* x, int32_t n) {\       for (int32_t i = 0; i < n; i++) x[i] = x[i] + 1;\     }\   ") |>   tcc_bind(add_vec = list(args = list("integer_array", "i32"), returns = "void")) |>   tcc_compile()  x <- sample(10000) bench::mark(   Rtinycc_vec = {     y <- as.integer(x)     y <- y + 0L     ffi_vec$add_vec(y, length(y))     y   },   Rbuiltin_vec = {     y <- as.integer(x)     y <- y + 0L     y + 1L   } ) #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   expression        min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec` #>   <bch:expr>   <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl> #> 1 Rtinycc_vec    67.1µs   94.8µs     9587.    39.1KB     6.57 #> 2 Rbuiltin_vec   39.7µs   42.3µs    20517.    78.2KB    30.0

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: can bind directly symbols shared libraries. link libm.
code: math <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_library("m") |>   tcc_bind(     sqrt  = list(args = list("f64"), returns = "f64"),     sin   = list(args = list("f64"), returns = "f64"),     floor = list(args = list("f64"), returns = "f64")   ) |>   tcc_compile()  math$sqrt(16.0) #> [1] 4 math$sin(pi / 2) #> [1] 1 math$floor(3.7) #> [1] 3

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: R vectors passed C zero copy. Mutations C visible R.
code: ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source("     #include <stdlib.h>     #include <string.h>      int64_t sum_array(int32_t* arr, int32_t n) {       int64_t s = 0;       for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) s += arr[i];       return s;     }      void bump_first(int32_t* arr) { arr[0] += 10; }      int32_t* dup_array(int32_t* arr, int32_t n) {       int32_t* out = malloc(sizeof(int32_t) * n);       memcpy(out, arr, sizeof(int32_t) * n);       return out;     }   ") |>   tcc_bind(     sum_array  = list(args = list("integer_array", "i32"), returns = "i64"),     bump_first = list(args = list("integer_array"), returns = "void"),     dup_array  = list(       args = list("integer_array", "i32"),       returns = list(type = "integer_array", length_arg = 2, free = TRUE)     )   ) |>   tcc_compile()  x <- as.integer(1:100) # to avoid ALTREP .Internal(inspect(x)) #> @5612bce2f0a8 13 INTSXP g0c0 [REF(65535)]  1 : 100 (compact) ffi$sum_array(x, length(x)) #> [1] 5050  # Zero-copy: C mutation reflects in R ffi$bump_first(x) #> NULL x[1] #> [1] 11  # Array return: copied into a new R vector, C buffer freed y <- ffi$dup_array(x, length(x)) y[1] #> [1] 11  .Internal(inspect(x)) #> @5612bce2f0a8 13 INTSXP g0c0 [REF(65535)]  11 : 110 (expanded)

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: example benchmarks classic convolution routine written plain C (manual SEXP code). Rtinycc generates .Call wrappers automatically. also compare quickr expected faster due compiler optimiztion.
code: library(quickr)  slow_convolve <- function(a, b) {   declare(type(a = double(NA)), type(b = double(NA)))   ab <- double(length(a) + length(b) - 1)   for (i in seq_along(a)) {     for (j in seq_along(b)) {       ab[i + j - 1] <- ab[i + j - 1] + a[i] * b[j]     }   }   ab }  ffi_conv <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source(" \     #include <stdlib.h>\     double* convolve(const double* a, int na, const double* b, int nb, int nab) {\       double* ab = (double*)calloc((size_t)nab, sizeof(double));\       if (!ab) return NULL;\       for (int i = 0; i < na; i++) {\         for (int j = 0; j < nb; j++) {\           ab[i + j] += a[i] * b[j];\         }\       }\       return ab;\     }\   ") |>   tcc_bind(     convolve = list(       args = list("numeric_array", "i32", "numeric_array", "i32", "i32"),       returns = list(type = "numeric_array", length_arg = 5, free = TRUE)     )   ) |>   tcc_compile()  set.seed(1) a <- runif(100000) b <- runif(100) na <- length(a) nb <- length(b) nab <- na + nb - 1L  quick_convolve <- quick(slow_convolve) timings <- bench::mark(   R = slow_convolve(a, b),   quickr = quick_convolve(a, b),   Rtinycc = ffi_conv$convolve(a, na, b, nb, nab),   min_time = 2 ) timings #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec` #>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl> #> 1 R             2.11s    2.11s     0.474     847KB     0    #> 2 quickr       9.96ms  10.53ms    95.2       782KB     1.55 #> 3 Rtinycc    172.72ms 180.83ms     5.32      782KB     0 plot(timings, type = "boxplot") + bench::scale_x_bench_time(base = NULL)

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: Complex C types supported declaratively. Use tcc_struct() generate allocation accessor helpers. Free instances done.
code: ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source('     #include <math.h>     struct point { double x; double y; };     double distance(struct point* a, struct point* b) {       double dx = a->x - b->x, dy = a->y - b->y;       return sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy);     }   ') |>   tcc_library("m") |>   tcc_struct("point", accessors = c(x = "f64", y = "f64")) |>   tcc_bind(distance = list(args = list("ptr", "ptr"), returns = "f64")) |>   tcc_compile()  p1 <- ffi$struct_point_new() ffi$struct_point_set_x(p1, 0.0) #> <pointer: 0x5612bb9abee0> ffi$struct_point_set_y(p1, 0.0) #> <pointer: 0x5612bb9abee0>  p2 <- ffi$struct_point_new() ffi$struct_point_set_x(p2, 3.0) #> <pointer: 0x5612be470c60> ffi$struct_point_set_y(p2, 4.0) #> <pointer: 0x5612be470c60>  ffi$distance(p1, p2) #> [1] 5  ffi$struct_point_free(p1) #> NULL ffi$struct_point_free(p2) #> NULL

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: Enums exposed helper functions return integer constants.
code: ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source("enum color { RED = 0, GREEN = 1, BLUE = 2 };") |>   tcc_enum("color", constants = c("RED", "GREEN", "BLUE")) |>   tcc_compile()  ffi$enum_color_RED() #> [1] 0 ffi$enum_color_BLUE() #> [1] 2

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: Bitfields handled TCC. Accessors read write like normal fields.
code: ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source("     struct flags {       unsigned int active : 1;       unsigned int level  : 4;     };   ") |>   tcc_struct("flags", accessors = c(active = "u8", level = "u8")) |>   tcc_compile()  s <- ffi$struct_flags_new() ffi$struct_flags_set_active(s, 1L) #> <pointer: 0x5612bfc6f8f0> ffi$struct_flags_set_level(s, 9L) #> <pointer: 0x5612bfc6f8f0> ffi$struct_flags_get_active(s) #> [1] 1 ffi$struct_flags_get_level(s) #> [1] 9 ffi$struct_flags_free(s) #> NULL

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: C globals can exposed explicit getter/setter helpers.
code: ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source("     int counter = 7;     double pi_approx = 3.14159;   ") |>   tcc_global("counter", "i32") |>   tcc_global("pi_approx", "f64") |>   tcc_compile()  ffi$global_counter_get() #> [1] 7 ffi$global_pi_approx_get() #> [1] 3.14159 ffi$global_counter_set(42L) #> [1] 42 ffi$global_counter_get() #> [1] 42

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: R functions can registered C function pointers via tcc_callback() passed compiled code. Specify callback:<signature> argument tcc_bind() trampoline generated automatically. Always close callbacks done.
code: cb <- tcc_callback(function(x) x * x, signature = "double (*)(double)")  code <- ' double apply_fn(double (*fn)(void* ctx, double), void* ctx, double x) {   return fn(ctx, x); } '  ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source(code) |>   tcc_bind(     apply_fn = list(       args = list("callback:double(double)", "ptr", "f64"),       returns = "f64"     )   ) |>   tcc_compile()  ffi$apply_fn(cb, tcc_callback_ptr(cb), 7.0) #> [1] 49 tcc_callback_close(cb)

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: callback throws R error, trampoline catches , emits warning, returns type-appropriate default (0 numeric, FALSE logical, NULL pointer). prevents C code seeing unwound stack.
code: cb_err <- tcc_callback(   function(x) stop("boom"),   signature = "double (*)(double)" )  ffi_err <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source('     double call_cb_err(double (*cb)(void* ctx, double), void* ctx, double x) {       return cb(ctx, x);     }   ') |>   tcc_bind(     call_cb_err = list(       args = list("callback:double(double)", "ptr", "f64"),       returns = "f64"     )   ) |>   tcc_compile()  warned <- FALSE res <- withCallingHandlers(   ffi_err$call_cb_err(cb_err, tcc_callback_ptr(cb_err), 1.0),   warning = function(w) {     warned <<- TRUE     invokeRestart("muffleWarning")   } ) list(warned = warned, result = res) #> $warned #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $result #> [1] NA tcc_callback_close(cb_err)

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: thread-safe scheduling worker threads, use callback_async:<signature> tcc_bind(). callback enqueued thread executed main R thread call tcc_callback_async_drain(). Call tcc_callback_async_enable() use.
code: tcc_callback_async_enable()  hits <- 0L cb_async <- tcc_callback(   function(x) { hits <<- hits + x; NULL },   signature = "void (*)(int)" )  code_async <- ' #include <pthread.h>  struct task { void (*cb)(void* ctx, int); void* ctx; int value; };  static void* worker(void* data) {   struct task* t = (struct task*) data;   t->cb(t->ctx, t->value);   return NULL; }  int spawn_async(void (*cb)(void* ctx, int), void* ctx, int value) {   if (!cb || !ctx) return -1;   const int n = 100;   struct task tasks[100];   pthread_t th[100];   for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {     tasks[i].cb = cb;     tasks[i].ctx = ctx;     tasks[i].value = value;     if (pthread_create(&th[i], NULL, worker, &tasks[i]) != 0) {       for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) pthread_join(th[j], NULL);       return -2;     }   }   for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) pthread_join(th[i], NULL);   return 0; } '  ffi_async <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source(code_async) |>   tcc_library("pthread") |>   tcc_bind(     spawn_async = list(       args = list("callback_async:void(int)", "ptr", "i32"),       returns = "i32"     )   ) |>   tcc_compile()  rc <- ffi_async$spawn_async(cb_async, tcc_callback_ptr(cb_async), 2L) tcc_callback_async_drain() hits #> [1] 200 tcc_callback_close(cb_async)

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: example ties together external library linking, callbacks, pointer dereferencing. open -memory SQLite database, execute queries, collect rows R callback reads char** arrays using tcc_read_ptr tcc_read_cstring.
code: ptr_size <- .Machine$sizeof.pointer  read_string_array <- function(ptr, n) {   vapply(seq_len(n), function(i) {     tcc_read_cstring(tcc_read_ptr(ptr, (i - 1L) * ptr_size))   }, "") }  cb <- tcc_callback(   function(argc, argv, cols) {     values <- read_string_array(argv, argc)     names  <- read_string_array(cols, argc)     cat(paste(names, values, sep = " = ", collapse = ", "), "\n")     0L   },   signature = "int (*)(int, char **, char **)" )  sqlite <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_header("#include <sqlite3.h>") |>   tcc_library("sqlite3") |>   tcc_source('     void* open_db() {       sqlite3* db = NULL;       sqlite3_open(":memory:", &db);       return db;     }     int close_db(void* db) {       return sqlite3_close((sqlite3*)db);     }   ') |>   tcc_bind(     open_db  = list(args = list(), returns = "ptr"),     close_db = list(args = list("ptr"), returns = "i32"),     sqlite3_libversion = list(args = list(), returns = "cstring"),     sqlite3_exec = list(       args = list("ptr", "cstring", "callback:int(int, char **, char **)", "ptr", "ptr"),       returns = "i32"     )   ) |>   tcc_compile()  sqlite$sqlite3_libversion() #> [1] "3.26.0"  db <- sqlite$open_db() sqlite$sqlite3_exec(db, "CREATE TABLE t (id INTEGER, name TEXT);", cb, tcc_callback_ptr(cb), tcc_null_ptr()) #> [1] 0 sqlite$sqlite3_exec(db, "INSERT INTO t VALUES (1, 'hello'), (2, 'world');", cb, tcc_callback_ptr(cb), tcc_null_ptr()) #> [1] 0 sqlite$sqlite3_exec(db, "SELECT * FROM t;", cb, tcc_callback_ptr(cb), tcc_null_ptr()) #> id = 1, name = hello  #> id = 2, name = world #> [1] 0 sqlite$close_db(db) #> [1] 0 tcc_callback_close(cb)

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: header-driven bindings, use treesitter.c parse function signatures generate binding specifications automatically. struct, enum, global helpers, tcc_generate_bindings() handles code generation. default mapper conservative pointers: char* treated ptr C guarantee NUL-terminated strings. know parameter C string, provide custom mapper returns cstring type.
code: header <- ' double sqrt(double x); double sin(double x); struct point { double x; double y; }; enum status { OK = 0, ERROR = 1 }; int global_counter; '  tcc_treesitter_functions(header) #>   capture_name text start_line start_col params return_type #> 1    decl_name sqrt          2         8 double      double #> 2    decl_name  sin          3         8 double      double tcc_treesitter_structs(header) #>   capture_name  text start_line #> 1  struct_name point          4 tcc_treesitter_enums(header) #>   capture_name   text start_line #> 1    enum_name status          5 tcc_treesitter_globals(header) #>   capture_name           text start_line #> 1  global_name global_counter          6  # Bind parsed functions to libm symbols <- tcc_treesitter_bindings(header) math <- tcc_link("m", symbols = symbols) math$sqrt(16.0) #> [1] 4  # Generate struct/enum/global helpers ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source(header) |>   tcc_generate_bindings(     header,     functions = FALSE, structs = TRUE,     enums = TRUE, globals = TRUE   ) |>   tcc_compile()  ffi$struct_point_new() #> <pointer: 0x5612b89c43e0> ffi$enum_status_OK() #> [1] 0 ffi$global_global_counter_get() #> [1] 0

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: accessor generator handle nested structs value. Use pointer fields instead reach inner structs tcc_field_addr().
code: ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source('     struct inner { int a; };     struct outer { struct inner* in; };   ') |>   tcc_struct("inner", accessors = c(a = "i32")) |>   tcc_struct("outer", accessors = c(`in` = "ptr")) |>   tcc_field_addr("outer", "in") |>   tcc_compile()  o <- ffi$struct_outer_new() i <- ffi$struct_inner_new() ffi$struct_inner_set_a(i, 42L) #> <pointer: 0x5612c5b56330>  # Write the inner pointer into the outer struct ffi$struct_outer_in_addr(o) |> tcc_ptr_set(i) #> <pointer: 0x5612c4e62850>  # Read it back through indirection ffi$struct_outer_in_addr(o) |>   tcc_data_ptr() |>   ffi$struct_inner_get_a() #> [1] 42  ffi$struct_inner_free(i) #> NULL ffi$struct_outer_free(o) #> NULL

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: Array fields require list(type = ..., size = N, array = TRUE) syntax tcc_struct(), generates element-wise accessors.
code: ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source('struct buf { unsigned char data[16]; };') |>   tcc_struct("buf", accessors = list(     data = list(type = "u8", size = 16, array = TRUE)   )) |>   tcc_compile()  b <- ffi$struct_buf_new() ffi$struct_buf_set_data_elt(b, 0L, 0xCAL) #> <pointer: 0x5612be363c40> ffi$struct_buf_set_data_elt(b, 1L, 0xFEL) #> <pointer: 0x5612be363c40> ffi$struct_buf_get_data_elt(b, 0L) #> [1] 202 ffi$struct_buf_get_data_elt(b, 1L) #> [1] 254 ffi$struct_buf_free(b) #> NULL

title: Builds TinyCC Cli and Library for C Scripting in R
text: Compiled FFI objects fork-safe: parallel::mclapply() fork()-based parallelism work box TCC’s compiled code lives memory mappings survive fork() via copy--write. Serialization also supported. tcc_compiled object stores FFI recipe internally, saveRDS() / readRDS() (serialize() / unserialize()), first $ access detects dead TCC state pointer recompiles transparently. explicit control, use tcc_recompile(). Note raw tcc_state objects bare pointers tcc_malloc() carry recipe remain dead deserialization.
code: ffi <- tcc_ffi() |>   tcc_source("int square(int x) { return x * x; }") |>   tcc_bind(square = list(args = list("i32"), returns = "i32")) |>   tcc_compile()  ffi$square(7L) #> [1] 49  tmp <- tempfile(fileext = ".rds") saveRDS(ffi, tmp) ffi2 <- readRDS(tmp) unlink(tmp)  # Auto-recompiles on first access ffi2$square(7L) #> [Rtinycc] Recompiling FFI bindings after deserialization #> [1] 49

title: Register an R function as a callback — tcc_callback
text: Thread safety: callbacks executed R main thread . Invoking callback worker thread unsupported may crash R. threadsafe flag currently informational . callback raises error, warning emitted type-appropriate default value returned. binding callbacks tcc_bind(), use callback:<signature> argument type synchronous trampoline generated. trampoline expects void* user-data pointer first argument; pass tcc_callback_ptr(cb) user-data argument C API. thread-safe usage worker threads, use callback_async:<signature> schedules call main thread returns default value. Pointer arguments (e.g., double*, int*) passed external pointers. Lengths must supplied separately needed. return type may scalar type supported FFI mappings (e.g., i32, f64, bool, cstring), SEXP return R object directly.

title: Declare a global variable getter — tcc_global
text: Globals limited scalar FFI types. Array types rejected. Scalar conversions follow rules wrapper arguments: Integer inputs (i8, i16, i32, u8, u16) must finite within range; NA values error. Large integer types (i64, u32, u64) mediated R numeric (double). Values must integer-valued within range; i64/u64 exact integers $2^53$ accepted. bool rejects NA logicals. Ownership notes: ptr globals store raw address external pointer. external pointer owns memory, keep alive; otherwise pointer may freed global still points . cstring globals store borrowed pointer R's string data (UTF-8 translation). free ; C-owned strings prefer ptr global manage lifetime explicitly (e.g., tcc_cstring()).

title: Link an external shared library with Bun-style FFI bindings — tcc_link
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Link SQLite with type-safe bindings sqlite <- tcc_link(   "libsqlite3.so",   symbols = list(     sqlite3_libversion = list(args = list(), returns = "cstring"),     sqlite3_open = list(args = list("cstring", "ptr"), returns = "i32")   ),   libs = "sqlite3" )  # Call directly - type conversion happens automatically sqlite$sqlite3_libversion()  # Example with custom user code for helper functions math_with_helpers <- tcc_link(   "m",   symbols = list(     sqrt = list(args = list("f64"), returns = "f64"),     safe_sqrt = list(args = list("f64"), returns = "f64")   ),   user_code = "     #include <math.h>      // Helper function that validates input before calling sqrt     double safe_sqrt(double x) {       if (x < 0) {         return NAN;       }       return sqrt(x);     }   ",   libs = "m" ) math_with_helpers$safe_sqrt(16.0) math_with_helpers$safe_sqrt(-4.0) # Returns NaN for negative input } # }

title: Rtinycc 0.0.3.9000 (development version)
text: Refactor FFI codegen callbacks use lambda.r guard rules instead long /else switch chains. keeps type-mapping logic centralized R/aaa_ffi_codegen_rules.R, makes behavior easier extend, reduces duplication across codegen sites. Fix exit-time segfaults Windows (potential issues platforms) setting onexit = FALSE R_RegisterCFinalizerEx() calls. External pointer finalizers TCC states, owned pointers, callbacks, JIT-generated struct/union constructors now run normal garbage collection, R shutdown. process exit OS reclaims memory; running teardown code runtime shutting caused crashes Windows due DLL unload ordering CRT heap teardown races. Treesitter helper examples now wrapped \dontrun{} treesitter helper tests skipped Windows avoid process-exit crashes related treesitter.c cleanup. Experimental Windows support. package now builds passes R CMD check Windows (Rtools 4.5 / UCRT). build system compiles TinyCC source via configure.win, dynamically links libtcc.dll, generates .def files R API symbol resolution. CRT heap consistency ensured redirecting TCC’s default msvcrt linkage ucrtbase.dll. Async callbacks fork()-based parallelism remain Unix-. See AGENTS.md implementation details. RC_invoke_callback_id() replaces snprintf-based callback dispatch. trampoline now passes callback token integer directly, eliminating round-trip string conversion relied snprintf (unavailable direct symbol Windows/UCRT).

title: Rtinycc 0.0.3
text: Add typed memory read/write helpers inspired Bun’s FFI ctypesio package: tcc_read_i8(), tcc_read_u8(), tcc_read_i16(), tcc_read_u16(), tcc_read_i32(), tcc_read_u32(), tcc_read_i64(), tcc_read_u64(), tcc_read_f32(), tcc_read_f64(), tcc_read_ptr() corresponding tcc_write_*() functions. operate byte offset use memcpy internally alignment safety. Legacy vectorised interface preserved: tcc_read_u8(ptr, n = 4), tcc_read_i32(ptr, n = 2), tcc_read_f64(ptr, n = 2) continue work alongside new scalar offset API. Fix macOS “undefined symbol” errors relocation time. RC_libtcc_add_host_symbols() explicitly registers host symbols (RC_free_finalizer, RC_invoke_callback, RC_callback_async_schedule_c) via tcc_add_symbol() tcc_relocate(). Fix macOS library linking: short library names like "m" resolved file path now passed -l<name> linker instead erroring. Fix stdbool.h found macOS: tcc_set_lib_path() now receives correct lib/tcc directory TCC resolves headers via {B}/include. tcc_compiled objects now survive serialize()/unserialize() saveRDS()/readRDS(). FFI recipe stored inside compiled object; first access deserialization, $.tcc_compiled detects dead TCC state pointer recompiles transparently. Compiled FFI objects fork-safe: parallel::mclapply() fork()-based parallelism work box since TCC’s compiled code lives memory mappings survive fork() via copy--write.

title: Rtinycc 0.0.2
text: Update package title description Mark first release API versioning going forward

title: Rtinycc 0.0.1.9000 (development version)
text: Generate callback trampolines callback:<signature> bindings C APIs can accept function pointers directly Add callback_async:<signature> thread-safe scheduling main thread Callback errors now warn return type-appropriate defaults (avoid longjmp) Update README examples callbacks, async callbacks, enums, bitfields Fix potential exit-time segfaults using package-level finalizer (RC_free_finalizer) generated struct/union helpers instead JIT-local finalizers Add treesitter.c helpers (tcc_treesitter_functions(), tcc_treesitter_structs(), tcc_treesitter_bindings()) aligned Rtinycc type mappings Require treesitter.c (>= 0.0.3) header parsing helpers Add global getter/setter helpers via tcc_global() generated global_<name>_get() global_<name>_set() accessors BREAKING: struct/union helper names now use struct_<name>_* union_<name>_* prefixes (including bitfields) Add tcc_generate_bindings() expanded tree-sitter helpers enum/union/global parsing binding generation Add pointer utilities: tcc_null_ptr(), tcc_malloc(), tcc_free(), tcc_read_*() helpers, pointer--pointer utilities (tcc_data_ptr(), tcc_ptr_set(), tcc_ptr_free_set_null()), ownership checks via tcc_ptr_is_owned() Tag external pointers owned/borrowed guard frees based ownership Add array field element helpers structs (struct_<name>_get_<field>_elt() / struct_<name>_set_<field>_elt()) Add array return specifications tcc_bind() via returns = list(type = "*_array", length_arg = ..., free = TRUE)

title: Rtinycc 0.0.1
text: First release

title: Rtinycc 0.0.0.9000 (development version)
text: Added bun:ffi inspired FFI API Add R callback API: tcc_callback(), tcc_callback_ptr(), tcc_callback_close() trampoline support passing R functions compiled C code Add structured type support: declarative tcc_struct() tcc_union() generated allocation/accessor helpers introspection (sizeof/alignof) Bitfield support (compiled TinyCC exposed via accessors) improved type mappings (scalars, zero-copy arrays, pointers) Modify configure script alter tinycc Makefile remove flat_namespace option macOS add simple return type tcc_call_symbol
